comments:
This is on 3.1 M7.

When I run the product export wizard for a multiple windows/mac/linux build 
from my .product file there is always an error dialog:

"Problems occurred while refreshing local changes" and a log entry:

!MESSAGE Resource /uk.ac.reload.straker/temp.folder/reload-
straker.jar.bin/uk/ac/reload/straker/editors/learningdesign does not exist.

Somewhere a background refresh is happening and complaining that these temp 
files do not exist.  I have "Refresh Automatically" turned on for my workbench 
preferences.  If I turn this off, the error does not occur.

It should be possible to suspend the automated refreshing for a specific project
during this export.

works great in N-20050615 with autorefresh and cross-platform export to all 10 
platforms.

This is still giving errors in RC3.  Also this is now affecting updates of CVS 
decorations:

let's reopen then.

DJ, being the resources guy you are, what's going on here?

This is the generic message that we use before we perform any resource
operation, when we check to ensure that the resource exists in the workspace. 

Its probably just a matter of the export creating/modifying/deleting files and
the background refresh is trying to keep up with it. 

We can investigate post-3.1.

The error tends to happen more when I start the product export and then 
immediately do something else at the same time, away from Eclipse, such as 
opening a new Windows explorer window.

We have another bug for the refresh errors (bug 102318), so I'm move this one to
CVS for the decoration errors. Presumably the decorator should just be silently
ignoring missing resources rather than logging.
